snippet: Islamic State militants swept into a Kurdish village near the Turkish border, while in the western Syrian city of Homs, twin car bombings killed at least 45 people.
abstract: Islamic State militants sweep into a Kurdish village in Syria near Turkish border, while in western Syrian city Homs, twin car bombs kill at least 45 people.

byline.original: By KARAM SHOUMALI and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali reported from Mertismail, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Mohammad Ghannam and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Islamic State militants swept into a Kurdish village near the Turkish border, while in the western Syrian city of Homs, twin car bombings killed at least 45 people.

headline.main: ISIS Takes a Kurdish Village in Syria as Car Bombs Kill Dozens in Homs
headline.print_headline: ISIS Takes a Kurdish Village in Syria as Car Bombs Kill Dozens in Homs

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
